channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mobile scaffolding tower to the side of the Gregorian pub, 26th September
item.description:
Insufficient footway widths, forcing pedestrians kerb side. Vulnerable users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St James's Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned, 26th September
item.description:
The car has been here outside my house since before 4am Wednesday 24th September. We don’t know who it belongs to and nobody has been to it since it got left. My mum has disabilities and my sister needs to park outside to take her to appointments and with this car in the way she can’t.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gavestone Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless, 26th September
item.description:

item.title: Outside Waitrose Finchley Road, 26th September
item.description:
One of the two benches on the pavement outside Waitrose Finchley Road has been completely broken - all the seating slats are missing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roofers throwing tiles from roof, 26th September
item.description:
3 Lansdowne Road roof is being worked on. Builders are on the roof throwing tiles from the roof into a skip nearby. Tiles are smashing and pieces are flying everywhere including the pavement and road. People use this road a lot, including older people and children. Someone is going to get injured. They aren't abiding by building regs, should be using a chute or pulley.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdowne Road, West Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Busy blocked road, 26th September
item.description:
Can the parking bay in church avenue just to the left of the exit of marks and Spencer’s car park be removed to enable a better flow of traffic for cars leaving the car park. This area is a bottleneck and causes traffic jams. This bay is not needed as there are plenty on the other side of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
